quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

quote: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

quote: Good code is its own best documentation.
author: Steve McConnell

quote: Programming isn’t about what you know; it’s about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Filipe Fortes

quote: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

quote: The only way to go fast is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

quote: Don’t comment bad code — rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

quote: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

quote: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

quote: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
author: Burt Rutan

quote: Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
author: Ellen Ullman

quote: Programming is learned by writing programs.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: If you think math is hard, try programming.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

quote: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
author: Steve Maguire

quote: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

quote: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take.
author: Roy Carlson

quote: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

quote: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

quote: Learning to write programs stretches your mind and helps you think better.
author: Bill Gates

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

quote: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Programs must be written to be read, not just executed.
author: Anonymous

quote: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

quote: Documentation is a love letter that you write to your future self.
author: Damian Conway

quote: It’s not a bug – it’s an undocumented feature.
author: Anonymous

quote: Simplicity carried to the extreme becomes elegance.
author: Jon Franklin

quote: Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it’s released. Beta is Latin for 'still doesn’t work'.
author: Anonymous

quote: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: Don’t worry if it doesn’t work right. If everything did, you’d be out of a job.
author: Mosher’s Law

quote: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: If debugging is the process of removing bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

quote: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
author: Anonymous

quote: Any code of your own that you haven’t looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson’s Law

quote: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

quote: A computer program does what you tell it to do, not what you want it to do.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the closest thing we have to magic.
author: Anonymous

quote: One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

quote: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

quote: To iterate is human, to recurse divine.
author: L. Peter Deutsch

quote: There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always complain about and those nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

quote: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard Pattis

quote: A language that doesn’t affect the way you think about programming is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Learning to program is learning to create and innovate.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can’t have great software without a great team.
author: Anonymous

quote: Programming is the art of telling another human what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however, they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

quote: It’s not that I’m so smart, it’s just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You might not think that programmers are artists, but programming is an extremely creative profession.
author: John Romero

quote: Programming allows you to think about thinking.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state.
author: J. Osterhout

quote: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

quote: In programming, the hard part isn’t solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
author: Paul Graham

quote: Programs should be written and read by humans, not just for computers.
author: Anonymous

quote: In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

quote: Software engineering is the part of computer science which is too difficult for the computer scientist.
author: Friedrich Bauer

quote: The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought, coupled with judiciously placed print statements.
author: Brian Kernighan

quote: If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Programs should be simple, but not simpler.
author: Anonymous

quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can’t lose.
author: Bill Gates

quote: A primary cause of complexity is that software vendors uncritically adopt almost any feature that users want.
author: Niklaus Wirth

quote: Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Software is a team sport, and great teams make great software.
author: Anonymous

quote: The best way to learn is to do; the worst way to teach is to talk.
author: Paul Halmos

quote: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

quote: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

quote: The harder you work for something, the greater you’ll feel when you achieve it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

quote: Opportunities don’t happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

quote: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Anonymous

quote: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don’t stop when you’re tired. Stop when you’re done.
author: Anonymous

quote: Little things make big days.
author: Anonymous

quote: It’s going to be hard, but hard does not mean impossible.
author: Anonymous

quote: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
author: Anonymous

quote: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Anonymous

quote: Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
author: Anonymous

quote: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Anonymous

quote: Success doesn’t just find you. You have to go out and get it.
author: Anonymous

quote: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
author: Gary Player
